page.title: 01Land North of Market Drayton
page.content: Calverhall is a small village in the north of Shropshire close to the borders of cheshire and staffordshire. the area is predomintely agricultural with littled evidence of new building developments. The agricultural units are farms of medium size and there are large farmhouses or halls with more modern agricultural buildings attached. The farms have amalgamated over the years to that there are isolated farmhoses now converted to domestic dwellinghouses only the land having been absorbed by other farms. There are two lakes attached to two country houses the lakes were once ornamental but are now used for recreational purposes. The population live in either the more isolated houses mentioned above or in the village itself and work either in agriculture or its associated services
